oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Field anesthesia
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nagy, Dusty W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine
anesthesia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There are a variety of methods for restraint and analgesia for surgical procedures in the bovine. A combination of manual restraint using chutes or ropes, local or regional nerve blocks, and anesthetic agents are often employed in the field. Compounds of varying anesthetic classes may be used singly or in combination to achieve the desired results for the procedure being performed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 259-260
